definition: branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: So, I actually also started pre-med.
sentences.chinese: 所以我最后选择了医学预科。

sentences.english: The second thing would be about the enrollment of the Pre-Music Program.
sentences.chinese: 第二件事是关于报读预科音乐课程。

sentences.english: The college also offers pre-education courses for more than 300 students who come from five medical universities.
sentences.chinese: 为五个医科大学培养本硕连读预科学生300余人。

sentences.english: Guanxi University's national minority preparatory course shift certain if rural area registered permanent residence?
sentences.chinese: 广西大学的少数民族预科班一定要是农村户口么？

sentences.english: In my numerous years of teaching, I've seen hundreds of students developing while they attend foundation courses.
sentences.chinese: 我从教多年，见证了数百名学生在预科学习中的进步。

sentences.english: Don't you have your own library, Preppie ?
sentences.chinese: 难道你们没有自己的图书馆，预科生？

sentences.english: In college, I did not hesitate to select a premedical curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 在大学，我毫不犹豫地选择了医学预科课程。

sentences.english: And for girls, they go to a prep school between the age of 4 and 11.
sentences.chinese: 对于女孩，她们在四岁和十一岁之间去预科学校。

sentences.english: At gymnasium, you saw a professor make a rainbow from light and mist.
sentences.chinese: 读预科时，你看见一个教授用光雾造出彩虹。

sentences.english: I took AP Econ, I took AP Environmental Science.
sentences.chinese: 我选了经济学和环境科学的预科。

sentences.english: National pre-college students should be concerned by a special group.
sentences.chinese: 民族预科生是应备受关注的特殊群体。

sentences.english: I would like to apply for the two undergraduate university matriculation.
sentences.chinese: 我要申请的是这两所大学的本科预科。

sentences.english: Her daughter has taken advancement placement, or AP, courses in French to earn credit toward college.
sentences.chinese: 她的女儿参加了法语的预科，为进入大学获得学分。

sentences.english: I took up one-year prior course in German in this college.
sentences.chinese: 我在这所大学读了一年的德语预科。
请注意你的脏话，预科生。

sentences.english: She's continuing to be pre-med, which is fantastic.
sentences.chinese: 她打算继续读医学预科。

definition: TOEFL/Test of English as a Foreign Language
(old) thanks to your lucky influence (polite reply to health inquiries)
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
credit system/grading system (in schools, universities etc)
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
